summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and a contractor, discussing technical assistance to make a large, non-searchable OPR draft report regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (2006-2008) searchable. The chain originates from an OPR letter transmitting the report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the Office of Professional Responsibility's draft report regarding the handling of his matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.

events.title: Handling of Epstein Matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period under review by the Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: OPR Transmits Draft Report
events.description: The Office of Professional Responsibility sends a letter and attached draft report to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York regarding its investigation into the handling of the Epstein matter.

locations: 930 Pennsylvania Avenue, NAV â€” Room 3266, Washington, D.C. 20330
keyFacts: The Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.
The draft report was transmitted to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020.
The attached OPR report was described as over 380 pages long and initially not searchable, requiring technical conversion.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to process this sensitive OPR report.
The document confirms an ongoing internal DOJ review of prosecutorial decisions in the early Epstein case years after his 2019 arrest.
